title: 16 - Candlestick Analysis & Trading Sessions - Timing and Candle Patterns

smc_candlestick_analysis.llm_summary: SMC Candlestick Analysis differs from traditional candlestick patterns. Instead of memorizing hundreds of patterns (doji, hammer, engulfing, etc.), SMC focuses on: 1) Candle body vs wick analysis for liquidity sweeps, 2) Candle close position relative to structure levels, 3) Candle that creates BOS/CHoCH, 4) Candle that forms Order Blocks. The emphasis is on WHERE candles appear in market structure and WHAT they represent (institutional activity) rather than pattern names. Body close validation is most critical element.
key_rules: Focus on body close position, not pattern names
Analyze candles in context of market structure
Wick vs body determines liquidity sweep vs valid break
Last candle before BOS = Order Block
Candle close beyond swing = valid structure move

body_vs_wick.llm_summary: Body vs Wick is the fundamental SMC candlestick principle. Candle Body = real price acceptance and institutional activity. Candle Wick = liquidity hunt or rejection. Body close beyond level = valid break/confirmation. Wick beyond level without body close = liquidity sweep/fake breakout. This single principle filters majority of false signals. Retail traders often react to wicks (getting trapped). SMC traders wait for body close confirmation.
key_rules: Body = price acceptance and institutional activity
Body close required for valid breaks
Always wait for body close confirmation

trading_sessions.llm_summary: Trading Sessions are specific time periods when different financial centers are active: 1) Asian Session (Tokyo), 2) London Session (most liquid), 3) New York Session (highest volume). Each session has different characteristics and volatility levels. London and New York overlap (Kill Zone) provides highest volatility and best SMC setups. Asian session typically ranges. SMC setups have higher probability during active sessions (London/NY) compared to Asian ranging periods.

kill_zone.llm_summary: Kill Zone is the specific time period during London-New York session overlap (typically 8am-11am NY time) when market volatility and institutional activity peak. This is when Smart Money makes major moves, taking out liquidity and initiating trends. SMC setups have highest probability during kill zones. The video emphasizes focusing trading activity on kill zones rather than trading all day. Quality timing over constant trading.
key_rules: Kill Zone = London-NY overlap (8-11am NY time typically)
Focus trading on kill zones, not all day
Major liquidity sweeps and BOS occur in kill zones

session_based_strategy.llm_summary: Session-Based Strategy involves aligning SMC trading with optimal time periods. Strategy: 1) Avoid Asian session or trade tight ranges only, 2) Prepare during Asian - mark OBs, FVGs, structure, 3) Execute during London/NY sessions when setups activate, 4) Focus maximum attention on kill zones, 5) Avoid trading during low-liquidity periods (session transitions, weekends). Time-based filtering increases probability significantly.

key_insights: SMC candlestick analysis focuses on body vs wick, not pattern names
Body close = price acceptance, Wick = liquidity hunt
Trading sessions matter - London/NY best for SMC setups
Kill Zone (London-NY overlap) = highest probability timing
Asian session for preparation, London/NY for execution
Context within market structure > traditional candle patterns
Time-based filtering significantly increases setup probability
Quality timing (kill zones) > trading all day
